feed.content: Mastering `Array.reduce()` is the key to cleaner data transformations.
Use `pathlib` instead of `os.path` for more readable file system operations.
Next.js 15 Server Actions make handling form state incredibly seamless.
Consistency is key. Always define a 4pt or 8pt grid system for spacing.
LLMs aren't databases; they are reasoning engines. Think 'RAG' for data retrieval.
Optional chaining `?.` prevents so many 'undefined' crashes. Use it!

Enumerate is better than range(len(x)). 

```python
for i, val in enumerate(list):
```
Optimize your LCP by using the Next/Image component with the 'priority' prop.
Dark mode shouldn't just be pure black. Use deep grays for better depth.
Zero-shot prompting vs Few-shot: Providing examples significantly boosts accuracy.
Always use `===` over `==` to avoid unexpected type coercion bugs.
The `with` statement ensures files are closed properly even if errors occur.
Incremental Static Regeneration (ISR) is a game changer for blogs.
Aria-labels are essential. If an icon doesn't have text, give it a label!
Tokens aren't words. 1000 tokens is roughly 750 words on average.
Nullish coalescing `??` is safer than `||` when checking for 0 or empty strings.
Pandas `.iloc` vs `.loc`: iloc is integer-based, loc is label-based.
Middleware in Next.js is perfect for authentication and bot protection.
Auto Layout in Figma is a must-learn for responsive design handoffs.
Vector databases like Pinecone are essential for scaling AI memory.
Use `Promise.allSettled` if you want to wait for all promises regardless of failure.
Python's `f-strings` are faster and more readable than `.format()`.
Partial Prerendering (PPR) is the future of hybrid web apps.
Don't hide important actions behind a 'hamburger' menu on desktop.
Temperature 0 makes AI deterministic; 0.7-1.0 makes it creative.
Avoid the 'callback hell'. Refactor old code to use async/await.
Keep your requirements.txt updated or use Poetry for dependency management.
The `parallel routes` feature allows multiple pages in the same layout.
Blue is the safest color for global accessibility in UI design.
AI Agents are just loops where the LLM decides the next tool to call.
ES Modules (`import/export`) are now standard across browsers and Node.
FastAPI uses Pydantic for validation, making API docs automatic.
Vercel's Edge Network reduces latency by running code closer to users.
Micro-interactions provide immediate feedback and delight the user.
The 'context window' determines how much history the AI can remember.
Stop using `var`. `let` and `const` provide block-scoping safety.
Use `zip()` to iterate over two lists in parallel easily.
Static Site Generation (SSG) is unbeatable for SEO-heavy pages.
Check your UI with a grayscale filter to ensure visual hierarchy holds up.
Fine-tuning is for style/format; RAG is for facts/knowledge.
Offload heavy computations to Web Workers to keep the UI thread smooth.
Decorators are a clean way to add logging or auth to functions.
Monorepos with Turborepo speed up build times for large Next.js apps.
Line length should be 45-75 characters for optimal readability.
Chain-of-Thought: Ask the AI to 'think step-by-step' for logic tasks.
Closures allow functions to remember the environment they were created in.
Vectorized operations in NumPy are 100x faster than standard Python loops.
Use the Metadata API for dynamic OG tags and better social sharing.
SVGs are always better than PNGs for icons. Scalability matters.
Multimodal AI can now process images, audio, and text simultaneously.
